{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Admin Volunteer",
  "description": "TEDxMaitama is an independently organised TED event operated under license from TED. It is a one-day event featuring eminent speakers from different fields that will share unique ideas about our community here in Abuja, Nigeria and beyond. We believe passionately in the power of ideas to change attitudes, lives and ultimately, the world. We believe in the power of conversations to shape minds into action.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin&nbsp;Volunteer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Summary


	We are seeking dedicated and self-driven volunteers to support various functions within the TEDx Maitama community.
	You will work with a collaborative team to plan, execute, and elevate TEDx events, projects, and community experiences throughout the year.


Key Responsibilities (General Across All Teams)
While each team has specific tasks, all volunteers may support the following:


	Contribute actively to planning and executing TEDx Maitama events and initiatives.
	Attend team meetings, planning sessions, and rehearsals as required.
	Collaborate with team leads to deliver assigned tasks on time.
	Bring creative ideas, solutions, and initiative to your department.
	Maintain clear communication and uphold TEDx values.
	Support event-day operations, helping to deliver a seamless attendee experience.


Qualifications


	Prior volunteering or event experience is an advantage (not compulsory).
	Must be reliable, proactive, and willing to learn.
	Strong communication skills.
	Ability to work in a team and collaborate across departments.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-28",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-29",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "TEDxMaitama"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "addressCountry": "NG"

}



Admin Volunteer Job at TEDxMaitama




        
    

        
        TEDxMaitama is an independently organised TED event operated under license from TED. It is a one-day event featuring eminent speakers from different fields that will share unique ideas about our community here in Abuja, Nigeria and beyond. We believe passionately in the power of ideas to change attitudes, lives and ultimately, the world. We believe in the power of conversations to shape minds into action.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin Volunteer

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking dedicated and self-driven volunteers to support various functions within the TEDx Maitama community.
	You will work with a collaborative team to plan, execute, and elevate TEDx events, projects, and community experiences throughout the year.


Key Responsibilities (General Across All Teams)
While each team has specific tasks, all volunteers may support the following:


	Contribute actively to planning and executing TEDx Maitama events and initiatives.
	Attend team meetings, planning sessions, and rehearsals as required.
	Collaborate with team leads to deliver assigned tasks on time.
	Bring creative ideas, solutions, and initiative to your department.
	Maintain clear communication and uphold TEDx values.
	Support event-day operations, helping to deliver a seamless attendee experience.


Qualifications


	Prior volunteering or event experience is an advantage (not compulsory).
	Must be reliable, proactive, and willing to learn.
	Strong communication skills.
	Ability to work in a team and collaborate across departments.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Logistics Officer",
  "description": "Bell Oil and Gas Limited is a leading indigenous oilfield services company, dedicated to consistently proffering solutions, driving local content development and capacity building in Nigeria. We offer an extensive range of high-quality professional services to clients across the facets of oil and gas industry and other industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Functional Area: Supply chain
Reports to: Logistics Supervisor

Overall Purpose of Job


	Effective tracking and coordination of inbound and outbound shipments.


Responsibilities


	Inbound and outbound goods validations and revalidations.
	Timely dispatch of validated goods from Lagos to PortHarcourt and client locations.
	Form M and PAAR processing.
	Adherence to supply chain processes and procedures
	Weekly logistics reporting.
	Liaising with freight forwarders and clearing agents.
	Coordinating port operations in collaboration with clearing agents.
	Assisting with Updating import delivery schedules.
	Logging in the arrival date of any vessel and the expected clearing date of consignment via the sea.
	Ensures consignments (via the air and sea) are cleared within the agreed time-frame; 10 working days after vessel is discharged for sea and 4 working days from NAHCO for air.
	Completes the goods validation form (GVF) on all receipts.
	Liaises with clearing agents, relevant government agencies, relevant government agencies and the clients.
	Ensures that invoicing processes are completed at client&rsquo;s site.
	Liaising with relevant staff members on stock management in other locations.
	Prepares documents necessary for goods delivery at each client&rsquo;s site.
	Oversees timely delivery of goods to clients in Lagos / Port Harcourt.


Person Specification


	A good University Degree.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in Logistics, preferably in the maritime or oil and gas industries
	Knowledge of transportation management is necessary for ensuring efficient movement of goods.
	Understanding and adhering to regulations related to global trade is required for international operations.
	Problem Solving skills, ability to quickly identify, analyse and resolve issues that arise in logistics operations.
	Effective Communication skills.
	Excellent interpersonal &amp; relationship management skills.
	Attention to detail.
	Honest and hardworking.
	Confident with good social skills.
	Team player.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV to:&nbsp;manpower@belloil.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-06",

    "@type": "Organization",

Logistics Officer Job at Bell Oil and Gas Limited




        
    

        
        Bell Oil and Gas Limited is a leading indigenous oilfield services company, dedicated to consistently proffering solutions, driving local content development and capacity building in Nigeria. We offer an extensive range of high-quality professional services to clients across the facets of oil and gas industry and other industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Officer
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Functional Area: Supply chain
Reports to: Logistics Supervisor

Overall Purpose of Job
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Effective tracking and coordination of inbound and outbound shipments.


Responsibilities


	Inbound and outbound goods validations and revalidations.
	Timely dispatch of validated goods from Lagos to PortHarcourt and client locations.
	Form M and PAAR processing.
	Adherence to supply chain processes and procedures
	Weekly logistics reporting.
	Liaising with freight forwarders and clearing agents.
	Coordinating port operations in collaboration with clearing agents.
	Assisting with Updating import delivery schedules.
	Logging in the arrival date of any vessel and the expected clearing date of consignment via the sea.
	Ensures consignments (via the air and sea) are cleared within the agreed time-frame; 10 working days after vessel is discharged for sea and 4 working days from NAHCO for air.
	Completes the goods validation form (GVF) on all receipts.
	Liaises with clearing agents, relevant government agencies, relevant government agencies and the clients.
	Ensures that invoicing processes are completed at client’s site.
	Liaising with relevant staff members on stock management in other locations.
	Prepares documents necessary for goods delivery at each client’s site.
	Oversees timely delivery of goods to clients in Lagos / Port Harcourt.


Person Specification


	A good University Degree.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in Logistics, preferably in the maritime or oil and gas industries
	Knowledge of transportation management is necessary for ensuring efficient movement of goods.
	Understanding and adhering to regulations related to global trade is required for international operations.
	Problem Solving skills, ability to quickly identify, analyse and resolve issues that arise in logistics operations.
	Effective Communication skills.
	Excellent interpersonal & relationship management skills.
	Attention to detail.
	Honest and hardworking.
	Confident with good social skills.
	Team player.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV to: manpower@belloil.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Executive",
  "description": "Prestigious Consulting is a professional HR consultancy firm. We focus on improving organizational performance through strategic people &amp; process management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are looking for an ambitious and result-driven Business Development Executive to identify growth opportunities, strengthen client relationships, and expand the organization&rsquo;s market presence.
	The candidate will play a critical role in developing partnerships, increasing patient engagement, and achieving business growth targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new business and partnership opportunities within the healthcare sector.
	Develop strategies to increase patient registration and corporate client engagement.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients.
	Prepare business proposals, presentations, and growth strategies.
	Conduct market research to identify emerging opportunities and trends.
	Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly business development targets.
	Work closely with management to align sales and marketing efforts.


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree / HND in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related discipline.
	2&ndash;3 years of experience in business development or sales.
	Healthcare or service industry experience is an added advantage.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Self-motivated, target-driven, and customer-oriented.


Salary
N250,000 &ndash; N300,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrprestigiousconsulting@outlook.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Business Development Executive Job at Prestigious Consulting




        
    

        
        Prestigious Consulting is a professional HR consultancy firm. We focus on improving organizational performance through strategic people & process management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for an ambitious and result-driven Business Development Executive to identify growth opportunities, strengthen client relationships, and expand the organization’s market presence.
	The candidate will play a critical role in developing partnerships, increasing patient engagement, and achieving business growth targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new business and partnership opportunities within the healthcare sector.
	Develop strategies to increase patient registration and corporate client engagement.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients.
	Prepare business proposals, presentations, and growth strategies.
	Conduct market research to identify emerging opportunities and trends.
	Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly business development targets.
	Work closely with management to align sales and marketing efforts.


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree / HND in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related discipline.
	2–3 years of experience in business development or sales.
	Healthcare or service industry experience is an added advantage.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Self-motivated, target-driven, and customer-oriented.


Salary
N250,000 – N300,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrprestigiousconsulting@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Visa Application Officer Job at Techdoctorinnovations




        
    

        
        Techdoctorinnovations, a Social Media Management, Rebranding, and Recruiment firm, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Visa Application Officer

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Handle visa applications for Canada, UK, USA, and European countries.
	Review and verify client documents for accuracy.
	Provide guidance, checklists, and updates to clients.
	Prepare cover letters, SOPs, sponsorship letters, and required documents.
	Manage appointments, follow-ups, and submissions.
	Maintain confidentiality and professionalism.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with experience.
	Proven experience with international visa applications.
	Strong communication and documentation skills.
	Attention to detail and ability to work under pressure.
	Must reside within Abraham Adesanya or Ajah environs.


Salary
N120,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: olamidetechdoctor@gmail.com or techdoctorinnovations@gmail.com using “Visa Application Officer” as the subject of the email.

Note: For inquiries, send a WhatsApp message to: 09138885064.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Internal Auditor",
  "description": "Otech Microfinance Bank is licensed by the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) to operate as a Microfinance Bank. We are focused on provision of financial inclusiveness to Small and Medium Scale Enterprises, Traders, Farmers, the economic active poor and under-served, and those that do not have access to banking services in the rural areas and who are at the bottom of the economic pyramid.

Microfinance Bank is endowed with an active Board made up of men and women who have distinguished themselves in banking, public service and entrepreneurship, and who bring strong competencies to the management of the bank. We are strategically positioned to provide excellent services to our customers and exceed all service expectations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Internal Auditor

Job Location:&nbsp;Wuse II, Abuja

Key Responsibilities
Audit Planning &amp; Execution:


	Develop and implement an annual internal audit plan based on risk assessment and management input.
	Conduct scheduled and unscheduled audits across departments and branches.
	Evaluate internal control systems and recommend improvements.


Risk Management &amp; Internal Control:


	Identify potential areas of operational and financial risk.
	Ensure effective internal controls are in place to mitigate financial and reputational risk.
	Monitor adherence to policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements (e.g., CBN guidelines, AML/CFT, KYC).


Compliance &amp; Regulatory Review:


	Verify compliance with statutory laws and internal regulations.
	Monitor timely and accurate regulatory returns (e.g; CBN, NDIC, FIRS, etc).
	Conduct periodic reviews to ensure anti-money laundering and fraud prevention mechanism are enforced.


Reporting:


	Prepare and submit monthly, quarterly, and annual internal audit reports to the board Audit Committe.
	Communicate audit findings recommendations to management and follow up on implementation.
	Maintain detailed and accurate audit work papers.


Advisory &amp; Government Support:


	Provide advisory support to management on process improvement and policy formulation.
	Participate in policy reviews and contribute to good corporate governance practices.
	Serve as secretary to the Board of Audit Committee.


Investigation:


	Conduct special investigations on suspected fraud, misconduct, or whistleblower concerns.
	Prepare investigative reports with documented evidence and recommendations for action.

  "validThrough": "2025-12-29",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Otech Microfinance Bank"
    
  },

Internal Auditor Job at Otech Microfinance Bank




        
    

        
        Otech Microfinance Bank is licensed by the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) to operate as a Microfinance Bank. We are focused on provision of financial inclusiveness to Small and Medium Scale Enterprises, Traders, Farmers, the economic active poor and under-served, and those that do not have access to banking services in the rural areas and who are at the bottom of the economic pyramid.

Microfinance Bank is endowed with an active Board made up of men and women who have distinguished themselves in banking, public service and entrepreneurship, and who bring strong competencies to the management of the bank. We are strategically positioned to provide excellent services to our customers and exceed all service expectations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Internal Auditor

Job Location: Wuse II, Abuja

Key Responsibilities
Audit Planning & Execution:


	Develop and implement an annual internal audit plan based on risk assessment and management input.
	Conduct scheduled and unscheduled audits across departments and branches.
	Evaluate internal control systems and recommend improvements.


Risk Management & Internal Control:


	Identify potential areas of operational and financial risk.
	Ensure effective internal controls are in place to mitigate financial and reputational risk.
	Monitor adherence to policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements (e.g., CBN guidelines, AML/CFT, KYC).


Compliance & Regulatory Review:


	Verify compliance with statutory laws and internal regulations.
	Monitor timely and accurate regulatory returns (e.g; CBN, NDIC, FIRS, etc).
	Conduct periodic reviews to ensure anti-money laundering and fraud prevention mechanism are enforced.


Reporting:


	Prepare and submit monthly, quarterly, and annual internal audit reports to the board Audit Committe.
	Communicate audit findings recommendations to management and follow up on implementation.
	Maintain detailed and accurate audit work papers.


Advisory & Government Support:


	Provide advisory support to management on process improvement and policy formulation.
	Participate in policy reviews and contribute to good corporate governance practices.
	Serve as secretary to the Board of Audit Committee.


Investigation:


	Conduct special investigations on suspected fraud, misconduct, or whistleblower concerns.
	Prepare investigative reports with documented evidence and recommendations for action.
    

    

        Click here to Apply
